name: Homeflow
headline: Simplifying insurance for large real estate investors
description: Homeflow is the first digital platform that gives larger real estate investors a single place to purchase and manage insurance for their portfolio. Rather than having policies spread out between multiple brokers, real estate managers can use Homeflow to view their policies, change coverages, and get quotes for upcoming acquisitions.

founders.name: Perry Ha, Founder
founders.description:
Perry is the cofounder and CEO of Homeflow, a digital platform that simplifies insurance for real estate invesotrs. Prior to Homeflow, he led Growth Initiatives at Hippo Insurance and was a VC associate at the Westly Group. 

Perry earned a BS in Mechanical Engineering at MIT, and in his free time, he enjoys woodworking, snowboarding, and trying new restaurants.

generated_description:
**Homeflow: Simplifying Insurance for Real Estate Investors**

Founded in 2022 and part of Y Combinator's W23 batch, Homeflow is a San Francisco-based startup with a clear mission: to simplify insurance for large real estate investors. The idea is both straightforward and powerful. Rather than juggling various insurance policies across multiple brokers—an exhausting task for any real estate manager—Homeflow provides a single digital platform where users can manage everything seamlessly.

Homeflow's platform allows real estate investors to get quotes, view existing policies, and adjust coverages in just a few clicks. They’re about efficiency; while it typically takes an hour for a homeowner to receive a single insurance quote, Homeflow promises multiple quotes in under five minutes. This not only saves time but potentially money, as users can easily compare quotes from over 30 different carriers to ensure they're getting the best deal.

Their coverage isn't just limited to traditional properties. Homeflow accommodates a wide range of real estate assets including single-family homes, duplexes, triplexes, quadplexes, condos, townhomes, Airbnbs, and even vacant land. This flexibility makes it an appealing choice for diverse portfolios.

The Homeflow team is currently small—only four employees—but is poised to make a significant impact in the proptech space. Under the guidance of their Group Partner, Diana Hu, they are tapping into a growing demand for digital solutions in the real estate sector.

If you’re involved in real estate and tired of the insurance chaos, Homeflow claims to have your back. With their commitment to speed, savings, and protection, they aim to change how real estate investors approach insurance. 

For more details and to get started, check out their website: [Homeflow](https://www.homeflow.me).
